trans-unit.source: Defines a style for speaking prompts that consists of settings for emphasis, rate, and volume.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle"></xref> class and specifies the setting for the emphasis of the style.
The speech synthesis engines in Windows do not support variations in the emphasis of speech output at this time.
Setting values for emphasis using a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration will produce no audible change in the synthesized speech output.
The setting for the emphasis of the style.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle"></xref> class and specifies the setting for the speaking rate of the style.
The setting for the speaking rate of the style.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle"></xref> class and specifies the setting for the speaking volume of the style.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume> setting for <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume> is full volume, which is the same as <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume>.
The other settings decrease the volume of speech output relative to full volume.
The setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.
Gets or sets the setting for the emphasis of the style.
The speech synthesis engines in Windows do not support variations in the emphasis of speech output at this time.
Setting values for emphasis using a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration will produce no audible change in the synthesized speech output.
Returns the setting for the emphasis of the style.
Gets or sets the setting for the speaking rate of the style.
Returns the setting for the speaking rate of the style.
Gets or sets the setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume> setting for <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume> is full volume, which is the same as <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume>.
The other settings decrease the volume of speech output relative to full volume.
Returns the setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.
